message: As the 115th session of Congress is called to order, I’m incredibly honored and humbled to have the opportunity to represent the hardworking families of California’s 24th Congressional District. This Congress brings with it an unprecedented set of challenges, but I am committed to providing increased economic opportunity and a better future for communities across the Central Coast.

President Obama spoke on Capitol Hill this morning underscoring the value of the Affordable Care Act. We cannot allow the Republican Majority to deny insurance to those with preexisting conditions, to our elderly relying on Medicare extensions, or to our children who cannot afford to pay for their own policy before joining the workforce. We must continue to improve upon the #ACA  – not completely dismantle healthcare coverage for millions of Americans.

Vice President Biden met with the Democratic Caucus for the final time while in office last night. He reminded us all of our duty to remain steadfast against abuses of power – and we snapped a #SaludSelfie!

Speaker Ryan’s renewed threat to defund Planned Parenthood as part of the Affordable Care Act repeal is a direct attack on the millions of women who rely on its services for basic medical care. I will continue to proudly #StandwithPP in Congress.

Received my first official national security briefing today from the Chairman of the Joint Chiefs, General Joseph F. Dunford, Jr.    We touched on the recent, publicly released report by our Intelligence Community detailing the ways in which Russia, at the highest levels of government, attempted to influence our elections. This should be of grave concern to us all – particularly our President-elect who has so far denied their interference.

Tonight, President Obama delivers his farewell address to the nation. With the momentum of a country yearning for hope and change, President Obama proved to us these past eight years that yes, we can achieve significant progress with hard work and determination. President and First Lady Michelle Obama modeled leadership with unfailing dignity and grace.   President Obama leaves behind a powerful legacy – from enacting national healthcare reform to implementing stringent protections for our environment and advocating for civil rights protections for all Americans. Thanks, Obama, you will be deeply missed.

As Republicans threaten to repeal the Affordable Care Act without putting forth a plan to replace it, every voice counts. That's why I want to hear directly from you. How has the #ACA helped you and your family?

In my first time speaking from the House Floor as a Member of Congress, I advocated on behalf of 45,000 Central Coast residents that now have access to reliable, affordable health care coverage thanks to the Affordable Care Act.

Yesterday, it was an honor to meet with Congressman John Lewis to celebrate the life and work of Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr.  Mr. Lewis recounted his meeting with other Civil Right leaders, including Dr. King, and President Kennedy ahead of the March on Washington convincing the President to allow them to organize. He reminded us all that sometimes it requires getting into some 'good trouble' to affect change.

Today I had the privilege of meeting Benjamin, one my constituents that can no longer be denied insurance for having a pre-existing condition under the Affordable Care Act. For Benjamin, and for the millions of Americans whose lives depend on the #ACA, I will continue to fight to improve - not repeal - this legislation.

May Dr. King's legacy continue to inspire us all to use our voices and talents as instruments of change.  "If you can't fly then run, if you can't run then walk, if you can't walk then crawl, but whatever you do you have to keep moving forward." – #MLK

I have appreciated hearing from my constituents regarding my attendance at the Inauguration this Friday. I understand your concerns with our President-elect and I share many of them – particularly in regards to the confirmed foreign interference in our elections, his refusal to fully divest from his business holdings, as well as his shameful behavior both during his campaign and since his election.   I have decided, after much deliberation, that the best way for me to stand up to our incoming president is to attend Friday’s Inauguration.   From the moment he takes office, I want the President-elect to know there are Members in Congress fighting for communities who will be greatly harmed by his misguided policy proposals and that we will not be ignored.   I want him to see the face of a Mexican immigrant newly elected to serve as the first Latino representative for the Central Coast and to know that the many groups he has disparaged and attacked over the course of his campaign have a strong voice in our government.  I am attending this inauguration not in celebration of a man that I do not respect, but rather to bear witness to our democratic institutions as a Member of Congress.  And the next day, I will proudly join my constituents and colleagues during the Women’s March on Washington to send a clear message to our new President about the values we stand for as a country.

I've spent much of my time these past few days listening to constituents and healthcare providers discuss the impacts of a repeal of the Affordable Care Act on the Central Coast. From these meetings and events it is clear, the plan to repeal the #ACA will have devastating impacts for the health and financial well-being of our communities.   We cannot allow Republicans to 'cut and run' from the almost 20 million Californians benefiting from increased access to healthcare under the ACA.
Thank you, President Obama.
Watch as the Congressional Hispanic Caucus takes a stand to protect our nation's immigrant population. #CHCtoTrump

Donald Trump made it clear today that he does not intend to represent all Americans as our President. As a proud Mexican immigrant, I want Mr. Trump to know that the groups he's consistently disparaged have a strong voice in our democracy.

Today, I marched in our nation's capital in solidarity with thousands of my constituents on the Central Coast. We march to say that we refuse to let Donald Trump eliminate decades of progress. We march because women's rights are human rights. We march to remind him that his actions and tweets have consequences. We march to say that we will defend our sacred freedom of the press that Trump seeks to dismantle. We march because today, tomorrow and the next day, we are dedicated to building a brighter and more inclusive future for our children.

Thank you to our emergency response personnel working around the clock to keep Central Coast residents protected during the effects of heavy flooding in our area. Santa Barbara County has issued an evacuation warning for residents in the Sherpa Fire area due to flash flooding. Our office is continuing to monitor the ongoing warning, please visit https://www.countyofsb.org/ for more updates throughout the day.

Donald Trump’s proposed border wall is nothing more than a multi-billion dollar symbol of xenophobia and hate. This is not a strategic investment in our national security and the American taxpayers will be stuck holding the bill. This morning, I met with Central Coast immigrant rights group CAUSE to reaffirm my commitment to our American values as a nation of immigrants. #WeStandWithImmigrants
I'm an immigrant, the son of a farmworker, and honored to serve California's Central Coast as a U.S. Congressman. We should all have this opportunity. #ImAlreadyHome

Today, I announced the introduction of my first piece of legislation in Congress – the California Clean Coast Act – to ban future oil drilling off California's Coast. The Central Coast's local economy and vibrant coastal ecosystem cannot afford another devastating oil spill. That is why it is critical that we pass this legislation to protect our coastal environment from further oil drilling and preserve its beauty and vibrancy for future generations to inherit.   Read more: https://goo.gl/bqajGI

An indiscriminate ban targeting immigrants based on religion or country of origin is not only a direct affront to American values, but a threat to our safety. Our country’s national security is paramount, and that is why I am co-sponsoring Representative Zoe Lofgren's SOLVe ACT, to void and defund the President’s reckless immigration ban.   We currently have one of the most stringent immigration systems in the world and I believe that we can ensure proper vetting of immigrants without violating our core American principles.
Last night, I stood with my colleagues on the steps of the Supreme Court to reject the President's immigration ban.

Thank you Major General Basham for presenting my office with the official seal of the Air Force. I look forward to working with the Department on the House Armed Services Committee to support our service members at Vandenberg Air Force Base, to grow our local economy and to invest in new energy technology.

Today I spoke on the House Floor to remind my colleagues, and the President, about the tangible impacts of the latest Executive Order on immigration – preventing Maryam Rasekh from pursuing her Ph. D at UC Santa Barbara.

Last night, Gina and I attended the annual Santa Maria Special Olympics Dinner to support Special Olympics on the Central Coast. The organizers put on a wonderful event once again and all for an incredibly worthwhile cause!

I look forward to expanding my work in Congress on behalf of nation's veterans and service members as Chair of the Congressional Hispanic Caucus Veterans and Armed Services Task Force. I will fight to ensure that all military service is properly honored and that veterans receive the benefits they have rightfully earned.

I joined hundreds of Central Coast residents in solidarity with the Muslim community to stand up against the President's recent and regrettable immigration ban. Targeting people based on their nationality or religion undermines our nation's values and puts Americans at risk by emboldening our adversaries. While the Executive Order has temporarily been blocked – the fight is far from over.

It is inexcusable that the majority of Senate Republicans have chosen party loyalty over the future of our children’s education today by confirming Betsy DeVos as Secretary of Education. DeVos' limited knowledge of our public education systems and functions proves a much greater threat to our children than the Grizzly Bears she alluded to justifying the presence of guns on our school's campuses during her confirmation hearing.   The Central Coast is home to several of our nation’s most distinguished public schools and universities. In Congress, I will continue to fight for increased access to affordable education.

I'm proud to join the bipartisan Congressional LGBT Equality Caucus to continue fighting to protect and expand equal rights protections for the LGBT Community. I look forward to working with my colleagues to stand up for our Central Coast values and to ensure that all Americans are treated with dignity and respect.

During this week's Armed Services Committee hearing, I asked leaders of each military branch how we can cut down on wasteful spending. There is no question that we must continue to maintain a strong military force, but we must also ask ourselves, if we ignore domestic priorities – what are we trying to protect?

Today's ruling by the 9th Circuit Court of Appeals, denying the reinstatement of the President's unconstitutional ban, is a victory for American values and for our national security. This decision reinforces the critical role of the judiciary in maintaining checks and balances of power.

Thank you North County Rape Crisis & Child Protection Center for rising with our community in Lompoc and with the over one billion women each year who are victims of sexual and physical violence worldwide. There is much work left to be done, but I am grateful to these tireless advocates on the Central Coast working to combat the exploitation of women and girls.
Happy anniversary to my wonderful wife, and my Valentine, Gina.

In the wake of Michael Flynn’s resignation as the President’s National Security Adviser, grave questions remain regarding the Administration’s communication with the Kremlin, both over the course of the campaign and since entering the White House. That is why I joined my colleagues to call for a bipartisan, independent, outside commission to fully investigate Russia’s influence on the Trump Administration and the 2016 election. Americans deserve concrete answers regarding the President and his advisers’ relationship with Russian officials, to ascertain the risk to our national security.    Read the full text of the Protecting Our Democracy Act: https://www.congress.gov/115/bills/hr356/BILLS-115hr356ih.pdf

Last night’s revelations detailing repeated contact between Russian intelligence officials and the Trump campaign, demand that we install an independent commission to investigate Russia’s influence on the 2016 election and in the White House.

I am deeply troubled by recent reports from across the country that immigrants with no criminal history, and even some protected under the Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals (DACA), are being arrested and deported as a result of the President’s recent Executive Order broadening the scope of Immigration and Customs Enforcement Agency (ICE) enforcement operations.    My staff and I are closely monitoring the situation on the Central Coast and are taking meetings with ICE officials in our area to ascertain the extent of their operations and future operating procedure regarding deportations under this Administration. Local ICE has informed our office that so far there has been no significant change in ICE operating procedure on the Central Coast and their focus remains on apprehending individuals with previous, high-level criminal convictions, not large scale enforcement actions.    I encourage my constituents to reach out to my office for more information to better understand their rights if approached by ICE officers or if they need assistance in working with the agency here: https://carbajal.house.gov/contact.

I just voted NO on H.J. Res. 43, legislation that would shamefully allow states to deny Title X funding to healthcare clinics. To deny federal funding to these clinics means restricting access to cancer screenings, birth control, STD and HIV testing, family planning services and preventative treatment our most vulnerable populations rely on.   Read our letter to Speaker Ryan defending Title X: https://goo.gl/Vd8Zcm
It’s been a busy few weeks in Congress, I brought in some extra paws for backup!

Wonderful to meet with so many politically engaged constituents in Carpinteria this morning during my sidewalk office hours!   Looking forward to our town hall in Arroyo Grande next week. Find event details and RSVP here: https://goo.gl/VOqBlZ.

Last week, I gave a speech on the House Floor recommitting to work first and foremost in the interest of the American public and Central Coast residents in Congress, regardless of political ideology. There are undoubtedly times that will call upon me to fight tooth and nail against policies that compromise our values, but I will never turn away an idea that benefits our community, regardless of which side of the aisle it originated.

There are many important challenges we face, from creating jobs and helping to improve the economy, to passing a comprehensive immigration reform bill, improving health care, or lowering the cost of higher education. Please take a moment to take my survey and let me know what you think should be the main focus of the 115th Congress:
Watch my Town Hall live, and feel free to ask questions below!

President Trump's repeal of Title X guidance, protecting the rights of transgender students in our public schools, shows a callous disregard for civil rights of the LGBT community. Gavin Grimm's brave willingness to challenge the Administration in court at a young age is an important step toward protecting and expanding on the significant progress we've made.

It is a privilege to host Izeah at tonight's Presidential Address. As the son of Mexican immigrants and the first in his family to attend college at UC Santa Barbara, Izeah’s success encapsulates the American dream – as well as illustrates the threat that the President’s xenophobic policies pose to America’s continued prosperity and strength.

Today, a successful launch of the Atlas V rocket from Vandenberg Air Force base brought into orbit a memorial to fallen Ventura County Firefighter, Ryan Osler. This well-deserved tribute to Mr. Osler, who lost his life while protecting our communities during the Canyon Fire last year, honored both his service and his family's sacrifice.
I spoke from the House Floor today urging this Administration and my colleagues in Congress to address the unsustainable $1.3 trillion student loan debt crisis.

Met yesterday with CA Attorney General, and my friend and mentor, Xavier Becerra as well as with CA Secretary of Natural Resources, John Laird. I'm proud to partner with our dedicated state leaders to work on behalf of Central Coast residents.

Reports that then-Senator Sessions met with the Russian Ambassador twice over the course of the presidential campaign, directly contradict his sworn testimony before the Senate Judiciary Committee stating he had no contact with Russian officials. Lying under oath disqualifies Attorney General Sessions from serving as our top law enforcement officer, and demands that he resign from his post.   At minimum, Sessions should recuse himself from any federal Russian investigation and an independent special prosecutor, without ties to the presidential campaign, should lead the inquiry.   This is yet another example of why it is so crucial that we pass the Protecting Our Democracy Act, legislation I have co-sponsored to establish an independent, bipartisan commission to investigate Russian attempts to influence our elections.

This Women’s History Month, I'm holding a Congressional ‘Women of the Year Award,’ to recognize women throughout the 24th District who have made a positive impact in our communities. Read more and nominate someone you know whose service has improved our quality of life on the Central Coast → http://bit.ly/2m3UT2F

Wonderful to join Santa Barbara Hillel's 14th annual Hall of Fame induction yesterday. I have been deeply disturbed by the recent rise of anti-Semitic violence across the country, including the desecration of Jewish cemeteries and bomb threats to Jewish Community Centers. I strongly condemn these hate crimes. Thank you to SB Hillel for your powerful and important advocacy on behalf of the Jewish community on the Central Coast.

Today, I met with UAW 5810 representatives who advocate on behalf of postdoctoral scholars in our University of California, including thousands of students from predominantly Muslim nations.  I saw a small cross-section of the talented academics that the President has alienated and made fearful with his latest Executive Order on immigration.  The President’s repackaged travel ban threatens our national security by validating our enemies’ criticisms of the United States and turns our back on innocent people, simply because of how they worship. No matter how many times the President restates this Order to achieve the same discriminatory goal – we will fight back.

House Republicans finally unveiled their harmful plan to repeal healthcare coverage, and are planning a vote on it before understanding its cost or how many Americans will lose insurance. My full statement on this legislation:

Military bases across the United States are cutting essential services as a result of the President’s indiscriminate hiring freeze across federal agencies. Here on the Central Coast, Vandenberg’s Child Development Center has stopped accepting new children into their program and has started a waiting list. It is unacceptable to expect our military personnel to bear the strain of the President’s impractical hiring freeze.

On International Women’s Day, we celebrate the innumerable contributions and infinite potential of women and girls around the world. As we honor the achievements of women today, this year we have been moved to greater collective action as we strive for equality. I am proud to wear red in solidarity with a Day Without a Woman, because we need a Congress that fights for equal pay, reproductive rights, and affordable health care.

Ayer, me uní con mis colegas del Comité Hispano del Congreso para enviar una carta al Sr. Kelly, Secretario del Departamento de Seguridad Interna para oponernos a la política que separaría a niños de sus madres en la frontera de México-Estados Unidos.  Lea toda la carta: http://bit.ly/2m3nEul

Congress needs to focus on fixing and improving our health care systems for our service members and civilians, not rolling back insurance coverage for millions of Americans.   That is why I introduced the Strengthening Preventive Health Care for Service Members Act to allow the Department of Defense (DoD), through TRICARE, to immediately expand preventive health care services for military service members and families.

As a Marine, I am concerned about the potentially hostile environment some members of the Marine Corps have cultivated toward female service members. I was incredibly disturbed by the discovery that Marines posted nude photos of female Marines on social media without their knowledge.  Today, I asked Lieutenant General Gary L. Thomas to quickly address the issue as well as to adapt better fitting body armor specifically for female service members. Every Marine – regardless of gender – should feel protected and supported by our military.

This week, House Republicans fast-tracked a healthcare repeal plan that would undoubtedly increase costs and take insurance coverage away from millions of Americans.  Join me Monday for a Town Hall meeting to discuss the potential repercussions of this reckless proposal.

It was an honor to join with Grizzly Youth Academy students and families at Camp SLO. I was so impressed by the dedication and commitment I saw from each Grizzly student to change the course of their lives. I'm proud to co-chair the National Guard's Youth ChalleNGe Caucus – to ensure that programs like Grizzly Academy are supported in Congress.
Watch my healthcare Town Hall live and follow along as I meet with constituents to discuss the potentially devastating impact of the proposed healthcare repeal in Congress

The House Majority is taking another step to advance a healthcare bill that would leave 24 million Americans uninsured over the next ten years, while simultaneously increasing costs for older Americans. Watch live as we fight this misguided #PayMoreForLess legislation in the Budget Committee:

The Trump Administration proposed to cut 31% of the Environmental Protection Agency’s (EPA) funding today when they released their annual budget request – the steepest cut made to any federal agency. On the Central Coast, we know too well the grave risks posed to our local ecosystems and economies when our environment is not protected. We will not go back.
A powerful reminder this St. Patrick’s Day from Irish Prime Minister Kenny. America is a nation of immigrants and our country has continuously found strength in its diversity.

Budgets are a reflection of our values. The cuts made in President Trump’s proposed budget to Congress last week outline a dark vision for the future of our nation. One that abandons the middle class and working families by cutting funding for infrastructure projects, scientific research, and public education. One that damages our national security by abandoning diplomacy, instead investing heavily in an ineffective and costly border wall. And one that leaves behind the most vulnerable, with drastic cuts to our community development programs, gutting after-school program funding and crippling Meals on Wheels.

Happy #NationalAgDay to our Central Coast farmers! Agriculture is at the heart of our region’s economy, and it is a privilege to represent a District with some of the most diverse (and delicious) agricultural products in the country. We deeply appreciate the farmers and workers that bring food to our markets and into our homes.

In the seven years since the ACA was signed into law, the progress we’ve made in expanding healthcare coverage is truly incredible. We’ve seen over 20 million Americans gain access to healthcare and our nation’s uninsured rate drop to its lowest point in history.   Today, I joined Vice President Joe Biden, Governor Jerry Brown, and my colleagues in Congress to stand together in opposition to the GOP’s healthcare repeal. We need to work together to improve the ACA and create a more equitable and more affordable healthcare system – not callously take insurance coverage away from millions.

Today, Congress was scheduled to vote on the House Majority's healthcare repeal bill, that would leave 24 million Americans without access to health coverage. On the Central Coast that’s 42,000 people who will be left uninsured by 2026. I’ve received hundreds of postcards, phone calls, and emails from concerned constituents from my District who demand Congress work together to create a more accessible and affordable healthcare system. Not the GOP plan that forces Americans to #PayMoreForLess.
Spoke from the House Floor this morning in opposition to the AHCA healthcare repeal. I will not support legislation that forces Americans to pay significantly more for less coverage.

The failure by the House Majority to pass their healthcare repeal bill is good news to the millions of families whose lives have been improved by gaining access to affordable, quality healthcare over the past seven years under the ACA. This misguided plan would have put an undue financial burden on our seniors, attacked women’s access to healthcare, and would have allowed insurance companies to charge millions of Americans significantly more for less coverage.    Congress must now work together in a bipartisan way to improve what needs fixing in the ACA and to create a more equitable and affordable healthcare system for all Americans. Thank you to those who called and wrote to make your voice heard in this critical debate. It made the difference.

The Trump Administration’s expanded immigration and deportation Executive Orders have created a culture of fear and anxiety in our Latino communities, so over the weekend I brought together representatives from immigration rights organizations and local officials from Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE). This meeting was the first step toward building a more transparent and direct communication line between immigration advocacy agencies and ICE officials, to share in information and address community concerns.

Russia continues to threaten and undermine democracies globally, including America’s. The Armed Services Committee met yesterday to assess Russia’s activities, and I asked General Scaparrotti how to effectively deter Russia’s aggressive influence. Watch my remarks below:

The Trump Administration is preparing two Executive Orders that will gut President Obama’s policies on climate change and water pollution. These actions attack vital environmental safeguards and promote fossil fuels at the expense of our natural environment. The Central Coast’s coastline and ecosystem is renown, and it is our responsibility to preserve and protect it.

Planned Parenthood serves 2.5 million Americans every year to provide accessible and affordable healthcare for both women and men. I met with representatives from Planned Parenthood to show that #IStandwithPP in strict opposition to any attempts by the GOP to defund an organization that gives lifesaving care.

Our military leaders have given Congress a clear message—Russia is a top threat to the United States and our interests. That’s why I’m urging my colleagues in the House to establish a bipartisan independent commission to investigate Russia’s outrageous behavior. Watch my floor speech below:

Today we honor the legacy of Cesar Chavez, a true civil rights leader who championed non-violence, justice, and equality. The struggles that farmworkers faced and continue to endure are a constant reminder that the fight for equality never ends.  As the son of an immigrant farmworker, I am proud to defend civil rights and the rights of our nation’s farmworkers. As we move forward it is important to keep the spirit of Cesar Chavez alive and remember the rallying call of the United Farm Workers “Si, Se Puede!”
Wonderful to engage with constituents in Goleta yesterday during my Sidewalk Office Hours! I always enjoy hearing directly from you about what issues matter most to Central Coast residents.

Over fifty years since the Equal Pay Act was signed into law the wage gap persists, harming not only women, but also the families they support. On #EqualPayDay I’m proud to cosponsor the Paycheck Fairness Act, because equal work should mean equal pay. Period.

Climate change is not only an environmental health issue, but a public health issue as well. The rise of infectious disease and respiratory illness is directly linked to extreme weather patterns and declining air quality – and Congress must take urgent action to address this deeply troubling connection.   That is why I sent a letter urging continued funding for the CDC’s Climate and Health Program, to help local health departments address and protect our health from the potentially devastating effects of climate change. Read the full letter below:

President Bashar al-Assad’s barbaric military and chemical weapons attacks this week against his own citizens in Syria, were heinous crimes against humanity and warranted action to hold him accountable.  I am concerned, however, that the Administration acted unilaterally, without seeking constitutional authorization from Congress. Before any further U.S. military action is taken in Syria, the President must obtain Congressional approval and articulate a long-term strategy for the region. To engage in further military action without a clear and transparent strategy to ensure we do not rush into another open-ended conflict in the Middle East, would be a disservice to our men and women in uniform.
I'm encouraging high school artists in CA-24 to apply for the Congressional Art Competition! Learn more:

Stopped by the Santa Barbara Soccer Club Girls Team practice to congratulate them on their recent Southern California State Cup victory. Glad to see such a talented group of athletes representing the Central Coast!

Great to visit the new SLO Food Bank and witness first-hand the positive impact they are making on the Central Coast to provide for the most vulnerable in our community. Food insecurity effects too many hard-working families and in Congress, I will continue to support funding for the SLO Food Bank and the National Food Assistance Program.

The Morro Bay National Estuary Program is key to the environmental stewardship of our estuary's precious coastal habitat and ecosystems. Thank you to Executive Director Bell for showing me a great bird's eye view of this special place. In Congress, I have joined a bipartisan group of my colleagues to urge full funding for our 28 National Estuary Programs, so that residents and visitors on the Central Coast can enjoy and learn from the Morro Bay Estuary for decades to come.

Tonight, I will join the UCSB Environmental Affairs Board and students for an important town hall discussion – and you’re invited! I look forward to engaging with the next generation of leaders from our community about the future of higher education, efforts to protect our environment, and badly needed immigration reform.

The Central Coast was incredibly well represented in yesterday’s Boston Marathon by third place finisher and Arroyo Grande native, Jordan Hasay! A huge congratulations to Jordan on her record-breaking marathon performance.

This week, I joined hundreds of community members in Paso Robles to “Walk A Mile in Her Shoes.” I walked (in high heels) with members of the community to help bring awareness to the disturbing pervasiveness of sexual and physical violence against women. Thank you RISE for hosting this empowering event, and for your unwavering efforts to support and defend victims of violence across San Luis Obispo County.

A fun morning spent reading with the children at Head Start in Atascadero! Every child on the Central Coast deserves to receive a high-quality education, and early childhood education programs like Head Start help close the achievement gap and ensure our children have the tools they need to succeed in school.

I joined Santa Barbara Mayor Schneider this week to oppose the President's devastating proposed budget cuts to vital Community Development Block (CDBG) programs on the Central Coast. Our communities depend on CDBG funding to run essential programs like Meals on Wheels, to build affordable housing, and to provide many other vital services to our most vulnerable residents.   Read more: http://www.independent.com/news/2017/apr/20/carbajal-schneider-resist-trump-cdbg-cuts/

Today millions of people around the world are uniting to commemorate Earth Day and encourage action from world leaders to protect our planet.   Earth Day holds a special significance in our communities, because we remember the impacts to our local economy and environment after the devastating 1969 oil spill off Santa Barbara’s coast. Here on the Central Coast we turned our tragedy into a movement that celebrates our planet and fosters the protection of the environment.  This year’s celebration holds an even greater importance and sense of urgency. We are faced with a President who does not share our values in acting to reduce the impacts of climate change and has rolled back key environmental protections during his first one hundred days in office.  Earth Day should serve us as a reminder to us all that we need to stay vigilant to safeguard the progress we’ve made in protecting the environment and public health.   As a Representative from one of the most beautiful and vibrant regions in our country, I know that we can overcome these challenges and make our planet an even better home for our children and grandchildren.

Proud to introduce the Federal Firefighters Fairness Act – legislation that grants federal firefighters equal disability and retirement benefits that state and local firefighters currently receive. Last year, when Lompoc and Vandenberg Air Force Base were both threatened by the aggressive Canyon Fire, 633 firefighters from federal, state and local fire agencies responded to protect our communities and infrastructure on the Central Coast. Fires do not discriminate between federal, state, or local firefights and neither should legislation.

Yesterday, I spoke on the House Floor urging my colleagues in Congress to pass a clean funding bill, without ideological riders. A government shutdown would mean disrupting economic growth and potentially triggering job losses across the country – Congress cannot allow the American public to foot the bill for irresponsible partisan gridlock.

Deeply troubled by reports that the Administration is considering opening up California’s coast to further offshore oil drilling. The Central Coast knows too well the economic and environmental havoc wreaked by oil and gas platforms off our coast. That is why it is critical that Congress immediately take-up the California Clean Coast Act, to permanently protect our coastal communities.

When dealing with an unpredictable regime like North Korea, empty rhetoric is dangerous. I asked Admiral Harris during our Armed Services Committee hearing, to explain the dysfunction surrounding deployment of the USS Carl Vinson and pressed him to outline a clear strategy regarding the tenuous Asia-Pacific region.

Today, the Trump Administration renewed the threat of further offshore oil drilling with an Executive Order to review oil and gas leasing programs in the Pacific, Arctic, and Atlantic Oceans. Spoke from the House Floor urging my colleagues in Congress to support the California Clean Coast Act – to permanently ban future oil drilling off our coast. The Central Coast remembers well the damaging impacts of offshore oil drilling to coastal economies, which are undeniably tied to clean coast and healthy ocean ecosystems.

I’m a proud immigrant, the son of farmworker, a veteran – and now I'm fortunate enough to serve the Central Coast as a member of the U.S. Congress. This #NationalImmigrantsDay, we recognize the many positive contributions of immigrants that have helped make this country great and firmly stand with immigrant communities in the face of policies guided by xenophobia and hate.

Proud to join Congressman David Cicilline today in introducing the bipartisan #EqualityAct. Our country has made significant gains in recent years in the fight for equality, but LGBT Americans still lack basic legal protections against discrimination in housing and employment opportunities. The Equality Act ensures that every LGBT person is given the right to live free from the fear of discrimination.

Today Congress acted in the best interest of the American people by voting to avoid a government shutdown and passing a bipartisan Appropriations package; containing important investments and compromises between Republicans and Democrats.   President Trump’s call yesterday for a “good shutdown” of the federal government is both irresponsible and reckless. The last government shutdown cost billions of dollars – stagnating our economy and threatening to destabilize our national security. Taxpayers should not be footing the bill for unnecessary partisan gridlock.

BREAKING: House GOP has scheduled a vote today on the American Health Care Act. The #ACHA guts protections for Americans with pre-existing conditions and drives up premium and deductible costs for millions. I remain strongly opposed to this harmful healthcare repeal.Thousands of Central Coast residents have benefited from the Affordable Care Act and I continue to hear powerful stories about the individual impacts of the ACA in our communities.

UPDATE FROM THE FLOOR: I just voted NO on the American Health Care Act. To get their harmful legislation passed today, the House Majority took a bill that leaves 24 million Americans without health insurance – and made it even worse.   Passage of the AHCA leaves Central Coast families with fewer protections, allowing insurers to make coverage prohibitively expensive for people with pre-existing conditions. Millions more will see their premiums and out-of-pocket costs increase by 25% on average, with an added ‘Age Tax’ imposed on Americans over fifty.   It is unacceptable that the House Majority forced a vote on legislation that will impact millions of lives without knowing its full cost or effect. I hope that my colleagues in the Senate will put the health of the American people over politics, and reject this misguided legislation.

Wonderful to visit the 30th Space Wing (Vandenberg Air Force Base, Calif.) and Space Operations Center and engage with dozens of men and women serving our country. Great to see firsthand, the innovation and dedication that everyone is putting into this groundbreaking work on the Central Coast.

Looking forward to engaging with students from the Cal Poly community at tonight's round table discussion on college affordability. As someone who relied on Pell grants to pursue a higher education, I am committed to finding ways in which Congress can most effectively reduce the burden from student loan debt.

Wonderful to join residents at Valle Verde Retirement Community in Santa Barbara, and address legitimate concerns regarding the healthcare repeal effort in Congress and its impact on older Americans. The Senate Majority just introduced the latest version of their ACA healthcare repeal bill, and it’s just as bad as the first. The remarkable impact of the ACA has been felt throughout the country, but especially in our state. In California alone, 4.29 million people would lose their health insurance under the Republican plan. This bill will negatively impact some of the most vulnerable Californians – increasing the rate of uninsured children by cutting Medicaid funding, charging people over 55 much higher premiums, and allowing insurers to discriminate against those with pre-existing conditions.  The ACA meant more people than ever before had access to insurance coverage, but there are still improvements to be made. Rather than repeal, we need to work together to achieve bi-partisan reform. Ideas like Permanent Reinsurance Programs would protect people with pre-existing conditions, while still keeping market prices low. Maintaining protections from the ACA while working toward creating more affordable healthcare options are essential to stabilizing the individual market and ensuring better coverage for more people, not less.   We cannot afford to give up the progress we’ve made to provide quality insurance to millions of Americans. Anthem Blue Cross of California announced yesterday that they plan to end coverage for people on the Affordable Care Act (ACA) individual health insurance plan in most of Southern California, including on the Central Coast, next year. Those affected will need to find a new insurance plan during the open enrollment period beginning this November. If anyone has issues during the enrollment period, please contact my office.   President Trump’s continued threats to “let Obamacare fail” by not making Cost Reduction Sharing (CRS) payments that keep insurance premiums down and not enforcing the individual mandate, have frustratingly helped destabilize our insurance markets. Insecurity among insurance companies lead to higher premiums, on the Central Coast specifically, rates are expected to go up by 6%.   Now, more than ever, Congress must to work across the aisle to improve healthcare system and bring down costs for all Americans. That is why I have joined with a bipartisan group of my colleagues in the ‘Problem Solvers Caucus’ to craft smart, bipartisan legislation that would stabilize the insurance markets and also keep out-of-pocket payments down. These proposals include mandatory funding for CRS payments and creating a permanent reinsurance program, which ended last year. I am also the proud co-sponsor of H.R. 1307, to create a public option under the ACA and provide much needed competition between private industry to bring down healthcare insurance costs.   I am glad to hear that the Chairman of the Senate Health Committee, Senator Alexander, will hold bipartisan hearings next month on ways we can strengthen the individual market after misguided attempts to repeal the Affordable Care Act. This is a step in the right direction.

Hosting a town hall in San Luis Obispo tonight with experts from the Nuclear Regulatory Commission (NRC) and PG&E regarding the Diablo Canyon Power Plant decommissioning process. Watch live:

Over the next decade, our community will undoubtedly be profoundly impacted by the decommissioning of #DiabloCanyon Nuclear Power Plant. It is my goal to host more of these meetings to ensure that local government officials and the public are informed about the role of the Federal agencies before, during, and after the power plant closes.

Gerardo Martinez is a computer engineer that has grown up and worked in the United States on our Central Coast for the last 13 years. The Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals program has given nearly 800,000 recipients like Gerardo a shot at the American dream, allowing them to come forward, live, work, and learn in the United States legally and without fear of deportation. Terminating DACA and stripping DREAMers of that hope and opportunity is unconscionable and incompatible with American values. #DefendDACA

With cyber-crime becoming an increasingly looming threat, it has never been more important to ensure our law enforcement agencies have the resources and training necessary to prevent cyber attacks. This week, I toured the California Cyber Training Complex (CCTC) at Camp San Luis Obispo to see their extensive training facilities and labs, which are at the forefront of training current law enforcement and military cyber security personnel. CCTC’s partnership with the California National Guard and California Polytechnic State University (Cal Poly) students creates opportunities for hands-on research and learning experience in a field that will be integral to protecting our institutions and national security. Thank you for the tour!

On #LaborDay, we celebrate the hard-won workers’ rights that brought better pay and safer conditions to millions of Americans.  For generations and even today, workers and labor organizations have stood up to ensure that the American Dream remains in reach for those who work hard. Today, I was proud to join with labor groups on the Central Coast and demand that the right to fair wages and benefits, affordable health care, and a secure retirement are protected.

DACA has given nearly 800,000 young people a shot at the American Dream, allowing them to come forward, live, work, and learn in the United States legally and without fear of deportation. This includes the over 9,000 students, entrepreneurs, and military members eligible for the program on the Central Coast. I was once a young immigrant to this nation, which has since given me the opportunity to work hard, raise my family, and serve my country both in the military and in Congress. Terminating DACA and stripping DREAMers of that hope and opportunity is unconscionable and incompatible with our American values.   We cannot afford to abandon DACA recipients, who have lived in America all their lives and contribute to this country in many ways. Ending this program undermines our economic growth and competitiveness, costing our economy $490 billion in lost GDP over the next decade in addition to losing potential innovation and entrepreneurship.  Congress must take immediate action to protect DREAMers before the program is set to expire. I am proud to co-sponsor the DREAM Act, to permanently codify DACA, and I urge my colleagues in the Majority to stand up for DREAMers by immediately bringing this legislation to the Floor for a vote.

As #HurricaneHarvey hit Texas, more than 90 airmen in the National Guard’s 129th from Camp Roberts, California were mobilized to help relief efforts. I had the privilege of meeting some of the men and women from this unit earlier this year, these dedicated servicemembers are making our Central Coast proud.
I'm proud to help lead this important effort to reduce air pollution and protect our marine life by slowing vessel speeds in shipping lanes along the #SantaBarbara channel.
I spoke on the House Floor today to urge action to protect our DREAMers. Congress must take up the #DREAMAct without delay.

Now that President Trump has rescinded DACA, many have questions about the status of #DREAMers in the U.S. Please share this information with your friends. If you or someone you know needs assistance, my office is here to help.

A big win for our Central Coast! The House passed my amendment this week, which takes important steps to improve the safety of our pipeline infrastructure across the country. Updated pipeline leak standards and automatic shut-off valves are essential to mitigate damage caused by oil spills on our communities.   The Central Coast saw this issue first-hand when it took over two hours to detect the source of the Plains’s Line 901 spill, where thousands of gallons of oil onto Refugio Beach and into the ocean.

On this solemn anniversary of September 11th, through our sadness, we proudly remember the tireless first-responders and the heroes who went out of their way to help a neighbor in need. Today, we especially honor those we lost and grieve with their loved ones. In some of our nation’s darkest hours, we showed the world what it means to be an American.   16 years later, we will #neverforget.

The American people deserve to know what the President’s intentions are for our public lands. Since President Trump announced his misguided review of our national monuments, I’ve called on the administration to leave them untouched and protected for future generations. Now, he is keeping recommendations from his Interior Secretary to alter the boundaries of these monuments, including the #CarrizoPlain on our Central Coast, a secret.
Honored to join USO in assembling care packages for our troops helping #HurricaneHarvey & #HurricaneIrma disaster relief efforts.

Took part in a productive meeting today with a bipartisan group of my colleagues in the Climate Solutions Caucus, along with outdoor recreation business leaders, to find common ground on mitigating the effects of climate change. The outdoor recreation industry in California alone employs almost 700,000 individuals and is already feeling the damaging impacts of climate change on our public lands. With shorter winters and rising sea levels we need to immediately #ActonClimate – this affects all those who enjoy the great outdoors, regardless of political party.
Let's make Hispanic Heritage Month a month of action. Congress must pass the DREAM Act to #ProtectDREAMers.

Last night, we learned Secretary Zinke recommended that President Trump reduce six national monuments and modify others to allow for drilling, mining, and logging. As more details emerge, it is clear that this is the beginning of an unprecedented attack on our public lands. While I am relieved that so far no recommended changes have been made to the Carrizo Plain National Monument on our Central Coast, we must continue to fight to protect thousands of acres of our public lands that include critical wildlife habitats, significant archaeological sites, and recreational open spaces, so that they are kept intact for future generations to enjoy.

This week, I am hosting our annual veterans' breakfasts in #Lompoc and #SLO! I'm grateful for this chance to personally thank our local veterans over a meal and to make my office available to assist with any issues our veterans have had with obtaining their benefits.   Please share this information with any veterans you may know in the area!

The fight to #ProtectOurCare isn't over. Senate Republicans are now attempting to pass their worst Affordable Care Act repeal yet, the Graham-Cassidy bill. This legislation would take away protections for millions with pre-existing conditions and premium costs would skyrocket, but we don't yet know its full impact because the Majority is not waiting for a report on the bill from the independent Congressional Budget Office.   Congress must work together to bring down healthcare costs and expand coverage for all Americans, not make it more expensive. I'm proud to cosponsor legislation permanently funding CSR payments to create greater stability in our insurance markets and to bring down costs, as well as legislation to offer a public option under the ACA to expand coverage for all Americans.

Reading constituent mail and hearing directly from you is one of my favorite parts of the job. This letter, from one of my youngest constituents in SLO, was one I had to share. While a firetruck or a cement mixer would be a much cooler ride, I drive a gold sedan. Thanks for writing to me, Everett!

Sen. McCain is right: a bill impacting healthcare for millions of American families and 1/5th of economy deserves a thorough, bipartisan process. His rejection of the #GrahamCassidy bill is welcome news, but the fight to protect our care isn't over. Under Graham-Cassidy, the average Californian's insurance premium will increase by over $4,000 annually. This isn't right. Health coverage is still far too expensive in this country. We must work together to bring down costs and to make healthcare more affordable for all Americans.

Working to grow businesses and keep our communities thriving as the Diablo Canyon decommissioning comes into effect is a top priority of mine. I’m grateful that this federal funding, in collaboration with Cal Poly’s CIE Innovation Lab and Accelerator program, will help #SLO create good paying jobs for residents by encouraging local entrepreneurship.
Proud to stand with DREAMers today by signing a discharge petition to force an immediate vote on the bipartisan #DREAMAct!

This week, we found ourselves once again banding together to save healthcare access for millions of Americans, when we really needed to focus on addressing the pressing problems of market stabilization in our health care system. Thank you all for your advocacy and efforts on behalf of those who rely on Medicare, who have pre-existing conditions, and the millions more who would be forced off their insurance with skyrocketing premium costs. I’m proud to work as a member of the bipartisan Problem Solvers’ Caucus with my colleagues in both parties to improve upon our existing law so that all Americans can have affordable, quality care. That starts with taking action to stabilize the marketplaces by permanently funding cost-sharing reduction subsidies and stopping Administration efforts to sabotage #ACA enrollment.

Grateful for the opportunity to thank our Central Coast #veterans in Lompoc. I'm proud to have introduced the bipartisan Veterans' Record Reconstruction Act this month, to help veterans to prove their eligibility for certain benefits or decorations. After a fire destroyed millions of WWII, Korean War, and Vietnam War veterans’ files over 40 years ago, the Department of Defense hasn't yet put in place an adequate system to reconstruct their history and determine their eligibility for benefits. That must change.

Horrified by reports from #LasVegas that yet another mass shooting has claimed innocent lives. My thoughts are with those victims and their loved ones. Thank you to our first responders and medical teams, who bravely put themselves in harm’s way to save lives in the wake of this tragedy.   While we grieve, we must also realize that offering only words and thoughts is not enough. Our nation is facing an unprecedented gun violence epidemic and Congress must take action to implement commonsense safety measures.

The House Majority just passed H.R. 36, reprehensible legislation that denies care to women seeking access to abortions, even in life-threatening circumstances. I spoke out against this legislation on behalf of Katie from California whose fetus was diagnosed with multiple severe health problems at 18 weeks, and who subsequently chose to terminate her pregnancy. As a member of the Pro-Choice Caucus, I am committed to working to protect a woman’s right to access safe abortion procedures.

As we mourn the loss of our neighbors, and the dozens of others who fell victim to the tragedy in Las Vegas, I offer my deepest condolences to the family and loved ones of Denise Cohen and Derrick Bo Taylor. I pray that our community offers them strength and comfort in this time of unimaginable grief.

Today is the last day to apply for a #DACA permit renewal. In less than six months, 800,000 hardworking young people will lose their right to work and to live in the United States, the country that most of them have grown up in and called home for as long as they can remember.  This Congress cannot let DREAMers live in fear of their futures. We must pass the DREAM Act immediately – for Erik, Alba, Lucio on the Central Coast, and for the thousands more counting on us to act.

Tomorrow marks Maestro Andy Sewell’s opening night with the San Luis Obispo Symphony, a welcome addition to our Central Coast arts community. It was a treat to run into the Maestro at Blackhorse last week and to wish him luck on his debut performance!

My thoughts are with our neighbors in Northern California as they continue to battle deadly wildfires. Thank you to those firefighters and first responders working tirelessly to contain the blazes, save lives, and mitigate damage to homes and businesses.

Yesterday, EPA Administrator Scott Pruitt announced he will reverse the Clean Power Plan, a policy that motivates states and industries to reduce their greenhouse gas emissions. As wildfires and hurricanes wreak havoc across our nation with record-breaking intensity, it is clear that we are experiencing the impacts of #climatechange now. We must act to mitigate its effects, not rollback progress protecting our public health and environment. We are out of time to debate this reality.

We cannot allow the natural disasters our nation faces to also become man-made disasters through inadequate response. Glad to vote today in support of badly needed emergency disaster funding for Hurricane Maria relief efforts in Puerto Rico and the US Virgin Islands, as well as for our devastating California wildfires. This must be only the beginning of our efforts to help communities across our country recover and rebuild after fatal hurricanes and wildfires.

The #IranDeal is working to prevent Iran from stockpiling enough material to develop nuclear weapon. While not perfect, it certainly makes us safer. The decision by President Trump today to decertify the JCPOA is shortsighted. It is also contrary to facts presented by even his own military and intelligence advisers, that Iran has complied with the terms of the agreement.   Iran is not our friend. We must work with our allies to address destabilizing conduct, but not at expense of blocking Iran's nuclear capabilities.

Tomorrow, I'm hosting an immigration forum with USCIS to help Central Coast residents get more information from the agency and to discuss issues surrounding immigration that impact their families. Please share with anyone you know who might benefit from this discussion.

Proud to join with U.S. Senator Kamala Harris to permanently protect 250,000 acres of California public lands in the Los Padres National Forest and Carrizo Plain National Monument. By designating these wilderness areas, we can prevent opening up these economically and environmentally significant open spaces from mining and drilling. #CCHPA

It has been 18 days since Congress failed to reauthorize #CHIP funding, which provides health insurance for 9 million kids nationwide. I hosted a roundtable meeting with local health care providers and insurers regarding the critical need to pass CHIP, which 30,000 Central Coast children rely on annually. Ensuring that all children have access to quality health care must remain top priority and I will continue to urge my colleagues to quickly reauthorize CHIP. Until then, we are failing our children.

The bipartisan Alexander-Murray healthcare compromise, to ensure Cost Sharing Reduction Subsidies, is an important step to reduce costs for Californians and Americans. As we continue to see companies like Anthem Blue Cross pull out of ACA Exchanges, it is critical that Congress act to ensure greater certainty in the market and I urge both Speaker Ryan and the President to support this bipartisan effort. I will continue to work with my colleagues to bring down insurance premium costs, including by co-sponsoring legislation to introduce a public option to the ACA in order to increase competition in our insurance markets.

October is Domestic Violence Awareness month, a time to shine a light on and to support domestic abuse victims and survivors in our community and throughout the country. This week, I toured The Women's Shelter Program of San Luis Obispo County, a program committed to providing a comprehensive response to victims of partner violence and child abuse.  We must do all that we can to support organizations that promote justice and provide a safe space for victims of domestic violence. Thank you for the tour and the important work you do for our Central Coast! #MoveToEndDV

While impossible to repay the great sacrifice made by our Gold Star families, who have lost loved ones in service to our nation, we must do all that we can to offer them our support. This month, I was proud to join my fellow veterans in Congress to co-sponsor H.R. 3897, a bipartisan bill that expands benefits for Gold Star families. Under current federal law, Gold Star families are only entitled to a lapel pin, with no requirement of access to installations and the potential to lose that access over time.  Passing this Gold Star Family Support Act is the least we can do to ensure that these families are given the compassion and recognition they deserve.
Healthcare Open Enrollment starts November 1st in California! It's time to #GetCovered by choosing a plan that works best for you and your family at www.coveredca.com.

I'm live with Facebook to discuss small businesses on the Central Coast. Starting a business takes an incredible amount of drive and we must support the spirit of entrepreneurship that creates good-paying jobs in our area. I’m working to increase funding opportunities for our small businesses through SBA.gov and to help our small businesses compete in a 21st century economy by growing their online presence. #FBBoost

Today's indictments show significant progress in the Department of Justice's #RussiaInvestigation and demonstrate that no one is above the law. They also bring into focus exactly how deep Russia's ties ran to close associates of the President during his campaign. Congress must remain committed to ensuring the Special Counsel's work continues independently and free from intimidation. The integrity of our elections, the most basic foundation of our democracy, depends on a thorough investigation.
Wishing everyone on the Central Coast a spooky and safe #Halloween!

November is Alzheimer's Awareness Month, a disease that unfortunately touches far too many families on the Central Coast and across the country. I was grateful to participate in this year’s Walk to End Alzheimer’s in Santa Barbara, an event to raise awareness for the over 5 million Americans are living with Alzheimer’s. It is critical that we support organizations that work to ensure quality care and provide support to families and loved ones who face the profound challenges of this disease.

I’m proud to work with Congressman Curbelo to introduce the bipartisan Coastal State Climate Preparedness Act. This year alone, FEMA will spend more than $22 Billion on recovery efforts, including for recent hurricanes and California's wildfires. H.R. 3533 will help coastal states better plan for extreme weather events and implement climate change adaptation strategies. We can save lives, homes and billions of taxpayer dollars by encouraging these vulnerable communities to prepare their infrastructure for the impacts of climate change.

The Santa Barbara County Veterans Stand Down in Santa Maria is an impressive example of organizations working together in our community to provide services for our Central Coast veterans. Thank you to my former colleague Supervisor Lavagnino for your leadership on this important event and to all the volunteers that made it possible.

Every year, three generations of Marine veterans gather together to cut a birthday cake with the Mameluke sword, to symbolize the annual renewal of each Marines’ commitment to the Corps.   I had the honor of being the guest of honor at the ceremony with three generation of Central Coast veterans this weekend, and to receive the first slice of cake. The second slice is then passed to the oldest Marine in attendance, who gives it to the youngest Marine present, symbolizing the passing of experience and knowledge from one generation to the next.     It was an honor to help kick off the Marine Corps birthday week with a ceremony that recognizes the heritage and history of the Corps. Happy 242nd birthday to the USMC!

Ahead of the President’s visit to Asia, I joined my fellow veterans in Congress urging him to consider the devastating cost of inciting ground war or a nuclear conflict on the Korean peninsula.  Earlier this year, I visited some of the 28,000 American troops  stationed in South Korea with my colleagues on the Armed Services Committee.  The tension at the DMZ was extraordinary, it would serve the President well to visit the border and see it first-hand.   It is imperative that the Administration exhaust all diplomatic efforts to create lasting peace in the region, not incite further military aggression. Read more: http://bit.ly/2yElNaS

It is disturbing to hear that the perpetrator of the mass shooting in Sutherland Springs was able to obtain a semi-automatic weapon, despite his criminal history, because of data entry failures. As a member of the House Armed Services Committee, I am asking Air Force Secretary Wilson why this information was not shared with the FBI and what steps they are taking to ensure this tragic mistake isn’t repeated.   Our background check systems need to be properly utilized, but it is also long overdue that Congress work to implement universal background checks to prevent future needless tragedy. In the 309 days I’ve served in Congress there have been 307 mass shootings. Enough is enough.

Great to catch-up with and congratulate a fellow veteran, Congressman Don Bacon this morning on the passage of the Gold Star Family Support and Installation Access Act. I'm proud to have worked with Rep. Bacon on this bipartisan bill which ensures the loved ones of those who paid the ultimate price defending our country have the support and respect they deserve.

After the Alamo and Whittier fires this year, many Central Coast families felt the financial hardships that come with natural disasters. This tax deduction will be instrumental in getting them back on their feet. The GOP tax plan would eliminate that deduction for many of those families.   I will continue to oppose a tax plan that does not maintain resources and support for Californians who fall victim to the devastation that follows earthquakes and wildfires.

Today, I join with my colleagues in honoring hundreds of DREAMers who currently serve in our military. As a young immigrant from Mexico, and a Marine Corps Reserves veteran, I share a similar sense of gratitude  for the opportunities this country has provided. DREAMers serving in our military help protect our national security, and I will continue to stand with them and urge Congress to pass the bipartisan DREAM Act. Watch live:

The Senate just unveiled their version of the GOP Tax Plan and Gary Cohn made it perfectly clear who it will help. By completely eliminating the State and Local Tax deduction, that benefits 145,738 taxpayers in my District, their plan is a direct hit to middle class families on the Central Coast.
Thankful for the men and women who have honorably served our nation, and for those who still are. Happy Veteran’s Day.
Happy 242nd birthday, Marine Corps. Semper Fi!

It is unacceptable that veterans who were injured in the line of duty can be priced out of housing assistance programs due to their disability benefits. I joined Central Coast veterans and affordable housing advocates to announce the introduction of bipartisan Home for the Brave Act to ensure our homeless and disabled veterans have access to safe, affordable housing. Read more: https://goo.gl/qAKgHD
Glad to catch Dos Pueblos High School's Football team earn their 10th straight win this weekend and to join fellow veterans for the coin flip. Go Chargers!

Technical education programs and apprenticeships are critical to ensuring Central Coast students are trained to enter a developing work force. I’m proud to support legislation recognizing November 13th as #NationalApprenticeshipWeek. The strong agricultural apprenticeships on the Central Coast, like Future Farmers of America's high school training program, and the partnerships between building trade unions and community colleges better prepare our students to obtain more quality, good-paying jobs.

I recently cosponsored HR 4156 to make sexual harassment training mandatory for Members of Congress and their staff. Today, I’m leading by example and completing the online training that my office has made mandatory so that our workplace is a safe place for everyone.

Earlier this week, I met with our local Planned Parenthood California Central Coast, which serves 33,363 men and women in my district. Planned Parenthood provides millions worldwide with trusted health care services and leads the fight to expand Americans’ access to comprehensive reproductive and sexual healthcare education. I continue to #StandwithPP and support the vital work of this organization.

My constituents are making their voice heard by calling, writing, and emailing my office…and 99% of them are asking me to oppose the #GOPTaxScam. As of today the numbers are:   Oppose: 1,530 Support: 15

Cancer has unfortunately touched so many lives, including someone in my own extended family currently undergoing treatment for Stage 4 Pancreatic cancer. Today, I’m wearing purple for World Pancreatic Cancer Day in honor of my friend Barbara, and to help spread awareness of pancreatic cancer symptoms and risk factors. Early detection is critical to beating this deadly disease and can mean more treatment options are available. Please join me in raising awareness in our community today!

Cal Poly produces some of the best and brightest students because they believe in learning by doing. I’m proud that Congress passed my amendment to the defense bill granting $5 million in funding authorization for aerospace engineering programs at Cal Poly that partner with the Air Force. These partnership programs provide unique opportunities for students to gain invaluable experience while also ensuring we maintain our military’s technological advantage through expanded research opportunities.

I just voted NO on the GOP Tax Plan, which gives a trillion dollar tax cut to multi-national corporations at the expense of students, homeowners, seniors and middle-class families.  The plan places new limits on mortgage interest deductions and eliminates the State and Local Tax Deduction, forcing Central Coast homeowners to pay an extra $15,000 a year on average and making it increasingly difficult to buy a home in California.  It also targets students, preventing many low and middle-income young people from gaining the skills they need to enter a 21st century workforce. The bill raises taxes on young graduate students and increases the cost of attending college by more than $65 billion dollars in the next decade, making college and graduate education unaffordable for many. We need bipartisan reform that simplifies the tax code and puts middle-class families first.

Yesterday I joined DACA recipients for a Thanksgiving lunch, and met two Dreamers from Guanajuato, the same Mexican state I was born in. As a young immigrant myself, I am grateful for the opportunities I had to get an education, work hard, and serve my county – both in the Marine Corps and in Congress. Every day that goes by without action on the Dream Act, 122 DACA recipients lose protection and access to those opportunities to contribute to the country they call home.

Too often our focus is on nuclear modernization and having “more” weapons, while ignoring the risks of nuclear proliferation to our national security. I’m pleased that this year’s defense spending bill includes my amendment requiring the Defense Department to propose strategies that mitigate the increasing threat of nuclear proliferation around the globe.

I just voted against the House’s tax plan because it is a bad deal for Central Coast families. The Senate GOP’s plan will include repealing the individual mandate, sending health insurance premiums skyrocketing and leaving 13 million more Americans uninsured. A bill that already explodes our deficit, and saddles our children with the trillion dollar debt, to fund tax cuts for the rich will now be even worse for middle class families.
Happy Birthday, Salud! #TeamCarbajal took over the page today to wish you another great year!

As a first generation college student, I relied heavily on student loans and financial aid opportunities, including Pell Grants, to help pay for my degree from UC Santa Barbara. In Congress, I strive to expand educational opportunities so that more students can realize their full potential. That’s why  I introduced the Middle Class CHANCE Act, which would raise the maximum award for Pell Grants, so students from all economic backgrounds have a more even playing field when it comes to affording the cost of higher education. Thanks, Council for Opportunity in Education - COE for celebrating first generation college students and for all you to do promote opportunity in education.

Our military is not immune to the impending threat of climate change. I co-sponsored an amendment to the National Defense Authorization Act that requires that the Dept. of Defense report on the effects of climate change on our military operations. Though long overdue, I am pleased to help include this historic language recognizing the impacts of climate change in our defense policy.

Net Neutrality facilitates technological innovation on the Central Coast, allowing small businesses to thrive. I oppose any plan that rolls back or eliminates the Net Neutrality protections that keep our internet free and open for all.

This wildfire season, California saw some of the deadliest and most destructive fires in the state’s history. Earlier this month, I joined with other California lawmakers requesting $7.4 billion of funding in the White House’s supplemental disaster funding package, so that California can begin to heal from fires that devastated our state. I am disappointed that the White House’s disaster funding request to Congress does not include any money for wildfire disaster relief, but I will continue to fight for increased funding so that California has the resources to recover and rebuild.
I’m thankful for the honor of representing the constituents of CA-24 in Congress. Wishing everyone a healthy and happy Thanksgiving with family and loved ones!

I am saddened to learn about the sudden passing of my former colleague, 4th District Santa Barbara County Supervisor Joni Gray. I served with Joni for 8 years on the Board. She was passionate about her views and public service. She was a strong advocate for the revitalization of historic Old Town Orcutt, ensuring a County government presence in Lompoc and a booster for Vandenberg Air Force Base. My thoughts and condolences go out to her family.

All workplaces should have zero-tolerance policies when it comes to harassment, including the halls of Congress. Today, the House voted to mandate that all members and staff receive annual sexual harassment awareness training. I'm proud to have cosponsored this legislation, but it is only the first step toward a workplace free from harassment. We must work toward a less opaque settlement process to make sure victims are no longer silenced.
From our world-renowned wine to our signature Santa Maria tri-tip, it’s hard not to love living on the Central Coast. Check out this New York Times feature on San Luis Obispo County!

Have questions about open enrollment and 2018 health insurance plans? Join The Santa Barbara County Public Health Department at their informational workshop this Monday! Certified Application Counselors will be available to assist individuals with Covered California and Medi-Cal health plan applications and renewals.

In the early hours of the morning, the Senate passed their version of the tax bill. Even accounting for economic growth, this bill adds $1 trillion to our deficit, while raising taxes on over 4 million middle class families in California alone. Congress must work together toward lasting tax reform that makes our tax code simpler and fairer, not one that eliminates the deductions that middle class families and small businesses rely on.

Eliminating protections on hundreds of acres of the Bear Ears and Grand Staircase-Escalante monuments is unprecedented and unacceptable. National Monuments, including the Central Coast’s own Carrizo Plain, are treasured among residents and integral to local economies. I stand with those opposing President Trump and Secretary Zinke’s attack on our public lands.

The Administration issued a new HHS rule that rolls back Affordable Care Act protections that provided 62.4 million women access to affordable birth control, without out of pocket costs that can range up to $255 per year. Make your voice heard before the public commenting period closes TOMORROW: http://bit.ly/2kpAAjr #HandsOffMyBC

Thank you to our brave firefighters and emergency personnel who have worked tirelessly through the night, against difficult conditions to fight the Thomas Fire and keep Central Coast residents safe. My thoughts are with everyone impacted by this terrible wildfire, especially those who have tragically lost homes and property.

The workplace should be a zero-tolerance zone when it comes to sexual harassment, Congress and political campaigns are not exceptions. As a County Supervisor, I was part of an organization with a transparent process for handling complaints and where my staff and I joined the rest of our workforce in completing required sexual harassment training. I was shocked to find that Congress does not strive for the same level of training and commitment to eliminating sexual harassment and protecting the victims.    I am especially outraged that taxpayers have been footing the bill for sexual harassment settlements. I am proud to cosponsor the ME TOO Congress Act, which would require Members of Congress who settle a claim as the harasser to repay taxpayers, as well as requiring those settlements to be published on-line every year. Members of Congress must be held to the highest standard and I am proud support legislation that promotes transparency and moves us closer to a workplace that is free from harassment.

As the Santa Ana winds continue to quickly spread the #ThomasFire north of Ojai and toward Santa Barbara County, please SHARE this updated evacuation and shelter map from Cal Fire. If you see fire approaching, evacuate immediately, do not wait to be told to leave.

The National Forest Service and National Guard have mobilized several air tankers against the Thomas Fire, including the large DC-10 out of Santa Maria Airport. These photos are from the Forest Service’s lead plane in Ventura County yesterday, as the tankers initiated air attacks.

With the Thomas Fire moving up the Central Coast at an alarming rate, I’m glad to announce that the Administration has authorized Governor Brown’s request for emergency federal assistance. The President’s declaration will allow for additional Department of Defense air support and shelter supplies. Yesterday, I spoke with FEMA officials about their coordinated federal response and ensuring the safety of all residents in the area, including my concerns over outdoor working conditions.
